comment: Very disappointed with Professor Askew's work ethic. Constantly rude to students that ask questions in class, and will not respond to emails about questions regarding grades. Lacks basic tools needed to be a decent professor. Would not recommend.

Professor Askew was a really good teacher and definitely knows a lot about this field. I liked how she taught, using examples and scenarios. But, she was sometimes rude to her students and not very organized. The syllabus was nothing like how the semester eventually was. But, I did learn a lot from her.

Dr. Askew is a very interesting professor.  I wouldn't say I disliked her class, but it was definitely not what I expected.  She's rather disorganized and tends to say one thing and mean another.  She is, however, an expert in her field.

She is one of the best professors I have had at KSU! She is pretty unclear with directions when it comes to at home assignments but she is always there to answer your questions IN CLASS she will NOT respond to emails. This class is entertaining, testsquizzes are short like MAX 20 questions. Usually late but make sure you're on time on test days.
She is one of the worst professors at KSU! Nothing is clear and specific.  She has a very bad attitude and very immature! Avoid at all cost!!

If your looking for a no effort A , this isnt the class for you. She is tough and expects students to participate and to atleast know the realm of study. She went out of her way to help me recieve an A and her class was always something new. Doesnt take role but somehow knows if you attend or not. Answer a question in class and your fine
Awful that's all that needs to be said

Not very clear when teaching. Most questions on tests and quizzes are going to be trick questions. Instructor has missed so many classes that we now have a test or quiz every day to make up for her absences. Instructor is also frequently late

Started off relating everything to real life situations & is knowledgable about the subject she teaches, you can tell she has a passion for it but doesn't do a very good job of teaching. Don't take if it's your major. Also shows up very late pretty frequently, but will penalize you if you're a few minutes late for a quiz or test, which are short.
She was terrible. Unprofessional. Took over a month to grade a SCANTRON exam. I will never take her again.
Most Organized teacher I have experienced at KSU

By far one of the worst professors at KSU! You are not going to Learn anything in her class. You have to buy the book and read everything! Her tests are uncleared, and not well put together. I would definitely stay away from any classes she teach! It's a waste of money and time!
Reading is a must!!

Like her as a person, HATED her as a teacher. Very unclear, very emotional/ easily offended. Tests are horribly made w/spelling errors and wrong information, trick questions that are irrelevant, and information that doesnt match what the book says. I learned nothing, and spent 120 on a book we read (literally) straight out of every class.

Terrible professor. Avoid this professor  at all cost. Her questions  for her essays are not cleared and specific at all. You basically have to write everything down, in which she suggest hoping your answer is in there somewhere! I Advise you to take Thornton or Bailey! At least with  one of them you would come out knowing something!

Worst teacher I have ever had. For some reason I was confused on when the final was, arrived to class late, explained myself and she would not let me take the final. Consequently, my grade dropped from a B to a D. Have to say she is quite merciless.

This is an online class and if you don't get an "A" get the hell out of college. She erratically requires you to post online for discussion but I have no idea if she counts them as graded assignments. If you don't care about corrections than take her because you won't have to put much time into the course. This is a complete self-taught course.

Very easy class. For sure you will get an A/ B. However, the professor is extremely immature ,playful and you really can't take anything she says seriously. I wouldn't take her again for any other course for sure. But if you are in it just to get a good grade and walk out empty headed than go for it!

Her class was good. Easy A/B if anything. Come to class and read your book. She often played a lot and I couldn't take her serious sometimes. Overall her class is EASY. Don't let her goofiness/immaturity scare you away. You'll get a good grade if you read and participate.

Material taught in class was very interesting to know.  Class was an easy A or B if you put a little work into it.As for the teacher(that's another story)I felt as though she treated the class like kids even though we were all adults. Often times she came across as having an attitude.If you don't mind that for 16 weeks,then take the class.
Very good class, entertaining and easy. Sometimes she drift off subject at times, but other than that I advise you to take her not only a easy grade but you learn real life situations
she is the best professor ever she teaches real life issues not going page page on things that dont apply in real life
